title: 15 Amazing Thanksgiving Décor Ideas For a Festive Home
description: Thanksgiving is a time to gather, celebrate, and give thanks, but it’s also an opportunity to showcase your home with festive décor that captures the season’s warmth. Whether hosting a big family dinner or enjoying a cozy, intimate gathering, your décor sets the tone for the celebration. From rustic charm to modern elegance, here are […]
author: Tahira
excerpt: Transform your home with creative Thanksgiving dÃ©cor ideas, including stylish centerpieces, warm accents, and festive table settings to wow your guests
text: Thanksgiving is a time to gather, celebrate, and give thanks, but itâ€™s also an opportunity to showcase your home with festive dÃ©cor that captures the season’s warmth. Whether hosting a big family dinner or enjoying a cozy, intimate gathering, your dÃ©cor sets the tone for the celebration. From rustic charm to modern elegance, here are 15 Thanksgiving dÃ©cor ideas that inspire you to create a beautiful, welcoming space. Each idea comes with suggestions of where to shop for similar items, with links to some great stores offering seasonal dÃ©cor. These stores, including Amazon, Wayfair, CB2, and others, are perfect for finding everything you need to bring your Thanksgiving vision to life. 1. Rustic Fall Wreath for a Welcoming Entryway Source: Wayfair Nothing says “Welcome” like a beautiful wreath on the front door. Choose a more natural and rustic wreath of wheat, dried leaves, or pinecones to catch the feeling of fall.  To bring in just a little more light and warmth for autumn, throwing in small pumpkins, acorns, or cranberries will add warmth with flair. You can easily match the color scheme of your home or fit your style by making a wreath to suit.  For a home with neutral tones, consider a wreath with muted greens and soft oranges rather than one with bright, traditional colors. You might also be tempted to print your banner or monogram for extra individuality and uniqueness. Where To Shop: Check out Etsyâ€™s handmade wreaths for unique, artisanal options, or browse Wayfairâ€™s selection for a variety of autumn-inspired wreaths. 2. Thanksgiving-Themed Table Runner Source: Macy Add a Thanksgiving table runner to your dining room. Choose a runner with beautiful autumn colors such as burgundy, deep oranges, and mustard yellows. Look for a pattern with Thanksgiving symbols like leaves, turkeys, or pumpkins to add a festive touch. Opt for a runner in one deep color such as burnt orange or gold, making your dinnerware stand out and providing an air of sophistication. Aside from being a unique type of decoration, this specific element works to keep your table clean and free from stains or scratches during the feast. Layer the runner over a neutral or solid-colored tablecloth for an added touch of elegance. Where To Shop: At Weston Table, they have plenty of designs to take your fancy, or opt for an affordable yet fashionable alternative from Macy’s for all your Thanksgiving decorating needs. 3. Pumpkin Centerpieces with a Twist Source: Balsamhill Pumpkins are synonymous with Thanksgiving, but you can take this traditional symbol to new levels by painting or decorating them. If you want an elegant appearance that is a bit classier, paint pumpkins in silver, gold, or metallic copper and it turns your table into the set of Downtown Abbey. You can paint them to match or use glitter, lace appliques, and even stencils for a color that pops with your overall theme. Group several of these pumpkins to the center on a table in various sizes and colors especially other styles. Combine with little gourds, leaves, or candles for a more natural feel in the middle. It’s a great way to put a contemporary twist on traditional Thanksgiving dÃ©cor. Where To Shop: Balsam Hill offers stunning pumpkin dÃ©cor, or find a wide range of sizes and colors at Amazon. 4. Cozy Thanksgiving Napkins and Napkin Rings Source: Wood Tailors Club No Thanksgiving dinner table is complete without the right napkins. Whether you prefer festive Thanksgiving napkins featuring turkeys and autumn leaves or more elegant cloth napkins in deep fall hues, they add a thoughtful touch to your table setting.  Elevate the look today, and pair your napkins with a unique new kind of accessory, i.e. customized Wooden Napkin Rings. Yes, goldâ€“wood napkin rings can fit perfectly into the rustic or modern theme that you go with. If you prefer a more personalized touch, monogrammed cloth napkins are a perfect takeaway offering for your guests. You can even match the napkins to your table runner or centerpiece for a cohesive and polished look. Where To Shop: For gorgeously embroidered Thanksgiving napkin sets, head over to Coral & Tusk, and Weston Table for napkin rings. 5. Elegant Candle Holders for Warm Ambiance Source: Wayfair Candles bring warmth and beauty to any Thanksgiving table setting. Opt for tall and skinny candlesticks to give height (and drama) to your table with a more refined sensibility. Gather clusters of votive candles in glass holders or wooden lanterns to create a warm and intimate ambiance. Choose candles with cinnamon, pumpkin spice, or apple scents for a seasonal touch. Not only do candle holders serve as decorative pieces, but they also create a soothing ambiance, helping to set the mood for a memorable Thanksgiving dinner. Where To Shop: CB2â€™s sleek candle holders add modern elegance, while Wayfair offers more traditional styles perfect for a cozy setting. 6. Plaid Throw Blankets for Outdoor Thanksgiving Gatherings Visualizer: eBay  Plaid throw blankets are a perfect accessory to keep your guests warm, especially if you plan an outdoor Thanksgiving. Lay those blankets over chairs or benches and have them readily available for guests who may want to wrap up if the evening gets chilly. Traditional fall colors of red, orange, and brown plaid blankets for warmth are decorative too. Whether your celebration is indoors or out, these throws can make your space feel more comfortable and inviting. Where To Shop: Check out FÃªte Home for stylish and high-quality plaid throws or browse Wayfair for a variety of affordable options. 7. Harvest Garland for Mantels and Staircases Source: Balsam Hill Garlands are a timeless and versatile addition to your Thanksgiving dÃ©cor. Opt for a harvest garland of artificial leaves, berries, and tiny pumpkins to achieve an old-world finish. Throw this over your mantel, wrap it around the railing on your staircase, or part of an arrangement for a festive tablescape. For a modern twist, add string lights or fairy lights to make your garland glow and set the mood for an evening of cheer. Garlands are a perfect way to bring different zones in your space together, creating a unified look throughout your home. Moreover, you can use them again the next year. Where To Shop: Balsam Hill offers beautiful, lifelike garlands, or you can find bold, whimsical options at Mackenzie-Childs. 8. Personalized Place Cards for Your Guests Source: Etsy Personalized place cards on the table express that you have taken thought and care in providing a delightful experience for your guests. You can mix it up, too, using mini pumpkins, pinecones, or tiny twigs to hold the name cards as well.  The point is that it adds a quaint charm to your table and gives your guests something tangible to take home as a memento. You could go a step further by including a small note of gratitude or a fun fact about each guest, making them feel even more special.  Where To Shop: Find unique place cards made or customized by hand on Etsy. Alternatively, there are many special choices in Uncommon Goods. 9. Cornucopia Centerpiece for a Classic Thanksgiving Look Source: Balsam Hills The cornucopia, often referred to as the “horn of plenty,” has always been a timeless symbol of abundance and harvest. This traditional centerpiece can be the focal point of your Thanksgiving table and serve as a symbol of gratitude and feasting. Start with a woven cornucopia basket to hold the arrangement. Fill it with a variety of gourds, seasonal fruits like apples and pears, and fresh or dried flowers for added color and texture. To create an inviting glow as the evening progresses, consider placing small, LED candles within the arrangement or alongside it. Where To Shop: For luxurious cornucopia baskets, Cornucopia Centerpieces, and decorating items, look up Balsam Hills and Fig & Dove. 10. Autumnal Wall Art for Seasonal Vibes Source: Wayfair Switch up your everyday wall art for autumnal pieces that channel the season’s vibe and transform your living space. Adding framed prints displaying scenic fall scenery, cheerful harvest themes, or motivational autumn quotes can boost the mood in your home. Mix bold and vibrant colors with softer, neutral tones to suit your taste. It is just so simple to deliver the vibe of Thanksgiving with wall art having golden leaves or rustic barn scenes. Where To Shop: For beautiful seasonal wall art, visit Devon Liedtke for stunning options or find budget-friendly alternatives on Wayfair. 11. Outdoor Thanksgiving Decorations with Lanterns Source: Little House on Chestnut  Give a boost of coziness to your Thanksgiving feast with glowing lanterns for the outdoors. Place lanterns down your walkway, on the porch, or even set up a few where you intend to eat outdoors. You can fill them with flickering candles or twinkling fairy lights, imparting magic to your party. If you prefer a more rustic touch, black metal lanterns or aged woodwork wonderfully with the ambient fall surroundings. You can also put larger lanterns as dining table centerpieces to make them more visible with the smaller ones that are surrounded by pinecones or seasonal flowers. Where To Shop: Find smart lantern options to suit your style at Wayfair or discover chic, affordable designs in Balsamhilâ€™s collection. 12. Thanksgiving-themed Dinnerware for a Festive Table Source: One King Lane Transform your dining experience with Thanksgiving-themed dinnerware that reflects the joy and festivity of the holiday. Consider earthy tones such as burnt orange, deep red, or muted gold to enhance your autumnal theme. Whether you prefer a matching set for a more formal dining experience or a mix-and-match style for a casual gathering, your dinnerware will play a significant role in setting the mood. Where To Shop: Weston Table and CB2 both offer stunning collections that can elevate your table, or find budget-friendly options on Amazon. 13. DIY Leaf Garland for a Personal Touch Source: Balsam Hill Get crafty this season by making a DIY leaf garland. Gather colorful autumn leaves (or use faux ones), string them together with twine, and hang the garland along your mantel or windows. You can even involve your family in this fun project, creating a special memory as part of your Thanksgiving preparations. This activity not only sparks creativity but also allows everyone to contribute their unique flair. You can also incorporate elements like small pinecones or acorns for added texture. Where To Shop: For faux leaves and crafting supplies, visit Etsy or explore Balsam Hill for all your DIY needs. 14. Decorative Fall Pillows for Extra Comfort Source: Amazon Add warmth and coziness to your living space with decorative fall pillows that invite relaxation. Look for designs featuring autumn motifs like pumpkins, leaves, or witty Thanksgiving quotes to complement your existing dÃ©cor. You can also mix solid-color pillows in warm hues such as burnt orange, mustard yellow, and deep red to create a harmonious look. These pillows not only enhance the aesthetic but also provide comfort for guests as they settle in for long conversations over a delicious Thanksgiving meal. Where To Shop: Check out Wayfair or Amazon for a wide selection of decorative pillows or find unique hand-sewn options at Coral and Tusk 15. Turkey Statue for a Festive Thanksgiving Table Source: Balsam Hill A turkey statue serves as a delightful centerpiece for your Thanksgiving table, embodying the spirit of the holiday. This charming piece can be crafted from various materials, such as ceramic, wood, or metal, adding texture and character to your dÃ©cor.  Placing a beautifully designed turkey statue at the heart of your table creates a focal point that draws guests’ attention and sparks conversation. Where To Shop: For exquisite turkey statues and other Thanksgiving dÃ©cor, visit Balsam Hill to explore their impressive collection. They offer a range of elegant and festive options that will elevate your holiday table setting. Wrap Up  At Home-Designing, weâ€™re passionate about helping you turn your design dreams into reality. We strive to inspire with practical tips and stunning home dÃ©cor ideas for every occasion. Whether youâ€™re decorating for a holiday or simply looking to refresh your space, weâ€™re here to guide you every step of the way. Happy Thanksgiving, and may your home be filled with warmth, beauty, and gratitude!
html:
Thanksgiving is a time to gather, celebrate, and give thanks, but itâ€™s also an opportunity to showcase your home with festive dÃ©cor that captures the season’s warmth. Whether hosting a big family dinner or enjoying a cozy, intimate gathering, your dÃ©cor sets the tone for the celebration. From rustic charm to modern elegance, here are 15 Thanksgiving dÃ©cor ideas that inspire you to create a beautiful, welcoming space.

Each idea comes with suggestions of where to shop for similar items, with links to some great stores offering seasonal dÃ©cor. These stores, including Amazon, Wayfair, CB2, and others, are perfect for finding everything you need to bring your Thanksgiving vision to life.

1. Rustic Fall Wreath for a Welcoming Entryway

Nothing says “Welcome” like a beautiful wreath on the front door. Choose a more natural and rustic wreath of wheat, dried leaves, or pinecones to catch the feeling of fall.  To bring in just a little more light and warmth for autumn, throwing in small pumpkins, acorns, or cranberries will add warmth with flair. You can easily match the color scheme of your home or fit your style by making a wreath to suit. 

For a home with neutral tones, consider a wreath with muted greens and soft oranges rather than one with bright, traditional colors. You might also be tempted to print your banner or monogram for extra individuality and uniqueness.

Where To Shop: Check out Etsyâ€™s handmade wreaths for unique, artisanal options, or browse Wayfairâ€™s selection for a variety of autumn-inspired wreaths.

2. Thanksgiving-Themed Table Runner

Add a Thanksgiving table runner to your dining room. Choose a runner with beautiful autumn colors such as burgundy, deep oranges, and mustard yellows. Look for a pattern with Thanksgiving symbols like leaves, turkeys, or pumpkins to add a festive touch. Opt for a runner in one deep color such as burnt orange or gold, making your dinnerware stand out and providing an air of sophistication.

Aside from being a unique type of decoration, this specific element works to keep your table clean and free from stains or scratches during the feast. Layer the runner over a neutral or solid-colored tablecloth for an added touch of elegance.

Where To Shop: At Weston Table, they have plenty of designs to take your fancy, or opt for an affordable yet fashionable alternative from Macy’s for all your Thanksgiving decorating needs.

3. Pumpkin Centerpieces with a Twist

Pumpkins are synonymous with Thanksgiving, but you can take this traditional symbol to new levels by painting or decorating them. If you want an elegant appearance that is a bit classier, paint pumpkins in silver, gold, or metallic copper and it turns your table into the set of Downtown Abbey. You can paint them to match or use glitter, lace appliques, and even stencils for a color that pops with your overall theme.

Group several of these pumpkins to the center on a table in various sizes and colors especially other styles. Combine with little gourds, leaves, or candles for a more natural feel in the middle. It’s a great way to put a contemporary twist on traditional Thanksgiving dÃ©cor.

Where To Shop: Balsam Hill offers stunning pumpkin dÃ©cor, or find a wide range of sizes and colors at Amazon.

4. Cozy Thanksgiving Napkins and Napkin Rings

No Thanksgiving dinner table is complete without the right napkins. Whether you prefer festive Thanksgiving napkins featuring turkeys and autumn leaves or more elegant cloth napkins in deep fall hues, they add a thoughtful touch to your table setting.

 Elevate the look today, and pair your napkins with a unique new kind of accessory, i.e. customized Wooden Napkin Rings. Yes, goldâ€“wood napkin rings can fit perfectly into the rustic or modern theme that you go with.

If you prefer a more personalized touch, monogrammed cloth napkins are a perfect takeaway offering for your guests. You can even match the napkins to your table runner or centerpiece for a cohesive and polished look.

Where To Shop: For gorgeously embroidered Thanksgiving napkin sets, head over to Coral & Tusk, and Weston Table for napkin rings.

5. Elegant Candle Holders for Warm Ambiance

Candles bring warmth and beauty to any Thanksgiving table setting. Opt for tall and skinny candlesticks to give height (and drama) to your table with a more refined sensibility.

Gather clusters of votive candles in glass holders or wooden lanterns to create a warm and intimate ambiance. Choose candles with cinnamon, pumpkin spice, or apple scents for a seasonal touch. Not only do candle holders serve as decorative pieces, but they also create a soothing ambiance, helping to set the mood for a memorable Thanksgiving dinner.

Where To Shop: CB2â€™s sleek candle holders add modern elegance, while Wayfair offers more traditional styles perfect for a cozy setting.

6. Plaid Throw Blankets for Outdoor Thanksgiving Gatherings

 Plaid throw blankets are a perfect accessory to keep your guests warm, especially if you plan an outdoor Thanksgiving. Lay those blankets over chairs or benches and have them readily available for guests who may want to wrap up if the evening gets chilly.

Traditional fall colors of red, orange, and brown plaid blankets for warmth are decorative too. Whether your celebration is indoors or out, these throws can make your space feel more comfortable and inviting.

Where To Shop: Check out FÃªte Home for stylish and high-quality plaid throws or browse Wayfair for a variety of affordable options.

7. Harvest Garland for Mantels and Staircases

Garlands are a timeless and versatile addition to your Thanksgiving dÃ©cor. Opt for a harvest garland of artificial leaves, berries, and tiny pumpkins to achieve an old-world finish. Throw this over your mantel, wrap it around the railing on your staircase, or part of an arrangement for a festive tablescape.

For a modern twist, add string lights or fairy lights to make your garland glow and set the mood for an evening of cheer. Garlands are a perfect way to bring different zones in your space together, creating a unified look throughout your home. Moreover, you can use them again the next year.

Where To Shop: Balsam Hill offers beautiful, lifelike garlands, or you can find bold, whimsical options at Mackenzie-Childs.

8. Personalized Place Cards for Your Guests

Personalized place cards on the table express that you have taken thought and care in providing a delightful experience for your guests. You can mix it up, too, using mini pumpkins, pinecones, or tiny twigs to hold the name cards as well. 

The point is that it adds a quaint charm to your table and gives your guests something tangible to take home as a memento. You could go a step further by including a small note of gratitude or a fun fact about each guest, making them feel even more special. 

Where To Shop: Find unique place cards made or customized by hand on Etsy. Alternatively, there are many special choices in Uncommon Goods.

9. Cornucopia Centerpiece for a Classic Thanksgiving Look

The cornucopia, often referred to as the “horn of plenty,” has always been a timeless symbol of abundance and harvest. This traditional centerpiece can be the focal point of your Thanksgiving table and serve as a symbol of gratitude and feasting.

Start with a woven cornucopia basket to hold the arrangement. Fill it with a variety of gourds, seasonal fruits like apples and pears, and fresh or dried flowers for added color and texture. To create an inviting glow as the evening progresses, consider placing small, LED candles within the arrangement or alongside it.

Where To Shop: For luxurious cornucopia baskets, Cornucopia Centerpieces, and decorating items, look up Balsam Hills and Fig & Dove.

10. Autumnal Wall Art for Seasonal Vibes

Switch up your everyday wall art for autumnal pieces that channel the season’s vibe and transform your living space. Adding framed prints displaying scenic fall scenery, cheerful harvest themes, or motivational autumn quotes can boost the mood in your home.

Mix bold and vibrant colors with softer, neutral tones to suit your taste. It is just so simple to deliver the vibe of Thanksgiving with wall art having golden leaves or rustic barn scenes.

Where To Shop: For beautiful seasonal wall art, visit Devon Liedtke for stunning options or find budget-friendly alternatives on Wayfair.

11. Outdoor Thanksgiving Decorations with Lanterns

 Give a boost of coziness to your Thanksgiving feast with glowing lanterns for the outdoors. Place lanterns down your walkway, on the porch, or even set up a few where you intend to eat outdoors. You can fill them with flickering candles or twinkling fairy lights, imparting magic to your party.

If you prefer a more rustic touch, black metal lanterns or aged woodwork wonderfully with the ambient fall surroundings. You can also put larger lanterns as dining table centerpieces to make them more visible with the smaller ones that are surrounded by pinecones or seasonal flowers.

Where To Shop: Find smart lantern options to suit your style at Wayfair or discover chic, affordable designs in Balsamhilâ€™s collection.

12. Thanksgiving-themed Dinnerware for a Festive Table

Transform your dining experience with Thanksgiving-themed dinnerware that reflects the joy and festivity of the holiday. Consider earthy tones such as burnt orange, deep red, or muted gold to enhance your autumnal theme.

Whether you prefer a matching set for a more formal dining experience or a mix-and-match style for a casual gathering, your dinnerware will play a significant role in setting the mood.

Where To Shop: Weston Table and CB2 both offer stunning collections that can elevate your table, or find budget-friendly options on Amazon.

13. DIY Leaf Garland for a Personal Touch

Get crafty this season by making a DIY leaf garland. Gather colorful autumn leaves (or use faux ones), string them together with twine, and hang the garland along your mantel or windows.

You can even involve your family in this fun project, creating a special memory as part of your Thanksgiving preparations. This activity not only sparks creativity but also allows everyone to contribute their unique flair. You can also incorporate elements like small pinecones or acorns for added texture.

Where To Shop: For faux leaves and crafting supplies, visit Etsy or explore Balsam Hill for all your DIY needs.

14. Decorative Fall Pillows for Extra Comfort

Add warmth and coziness to your living space with decorative fall pillows that invite relaxation. Look for designs featuring autumn motifs like pumpkins, leaves, or witty Thanksgiving quotes to complement your existing dÃ©cor.

You can also mix solid-color pillows in warm hues such as burnt orange, mustard yellow, and deep red to create a harmonious look. These pillows not only enhance the aesthetic but also provide comfort for guests as they settle in for long conversations over a delicious Thanksgiving meal.

Where To Shop: Check out Wayfair or Amazon for a wide selection of decorative pillows or find unique hand-sewn options at Coral and Tusk

15. Turkey Statue for a Festive Thanksgiving Table

A turkey statue serves as a delightful centerpiece for your Thanksgiving table, embodying the spirit of the holiday. This charming piece can be crafted from various materials, such as ceramic, wood, or metal, adding texture and character to your dÃ©cor. 

Placing a beautifully designed turkey statue at the heart of your table creates a focal point that draws guests’ attention and sparks conversation.

Where To Shop: For exquisite turkey statues and other Thanksgiving dÃ©cor, visit Balsam Hill to explore their impressive collection. They offer a range of elegant and festive options that will elevate your holiday table setting.

Wrap Up 

At Home-Designing, weâ€™re passionate about helping you turn your design dreams into reality. We strive to inspire with practical tips and stunning home dÃ©cor ideas for every occasion. Whether youâ€™re decorating for a holiday or simply looking to refresh your space, weâ€™re here to guide you every step of the way. Happy Thanksgiving, and may your home be filled with warmth, beauty, and gratitude!
